oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Caspar Mansker memorial grave marker, Peay Park, Goodlettsville, Tennessee, 1981 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Casper Mansker’s memorial grave marker, located in Goodlettsville’s Peay Park, circa June 1981. Mansker was originally buried at the site of his station, but in 1956 his remains were disinterred and moved to new site. Casper (Kasper) Mansker was a prominent Cumberland frontiersman, a longhunter, pioneer, Indian fighter, soldier and one of middle Tennessee’s first European explorers and settlers. He was a signer of the Cumberland Compact in 1780, which established the first government in the Cumberland Valley. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mansker family
